thread.title: The 3 Best Conspiracy Theories About the Statue of Liberty Going Dark
thread.title_full: The 3 Best Conspiracy Theories About the Statue of Liberty Going Dark

author: Zamira Rahim
title: The 3 Best Conspiracy Theories About the Statue of Liberty Going Dark
text:
The lights at the Statue of Liberty ominously went dark for a few hours on Tuesday and the symbolism was too much for the Internet.
The National Parks Service were quick to say in a statement that the ‚Äúunplanned outage‚Äù was most likely caused by some construction work, the BBC reports. But Twitter users weren‚Äôt going let a reasonable explanation spoil a good story.
Here are some of the best theories online.
The Statue Went On Strike For ‚ÄòA Day Without Women‚Äô 
March 8 is International Women‚Äôs Day and many people are marking the event by going on strike for ‚ÄòA Day Without Women‚Äô, in order to illustrate how important women can be.

It only seems fair that this extends to the most famous female (statue) in the U.S.
The Statue of Liberty has gone dark on #InternationalWomensDay ? A silent protest from Lady Liberty? #Trump #sexism #IWD2017 pic.twitter.com/sUUA2Rocsm 
‚Äî Peter Murphy (@PeterWMurphy1) March 8, 2017 
Lights off at Statue of Liberty. Powerful #DayWithoutAWoman message if that's why! pic.twitter.com/PHz599LtWD 
‚Äî Jordan Uhl (@JordanUhl) March 8, 2017 
Isn't today "A Day Without Women" by New York's time? Maybe that's why The Statue of Liberty has gone dark.
‚Äî Leah Jackson (@Leah____J) March 8, 2017 
The Statue Was Protesting President Trump‚Äôs Travel Ban 
President Trump just signed a second executive order temporarily banning some refugees and visitors from six predominantly Muslim countries.
Lady Liberty is widely thought of as a symbol welcoming immigrants to the U.S. so people were quick to jump on the idea of the power cut as a political protest. A ‚ÄúRefugees Welcome‚Äù banner was unfurled by activists at the feet of the statue just a few weeks ago.
There is nothing coincidental about the loss of power at the Statue of Liberty. Her lights dimmed in reply to another travel ban.
‚Äî Mike's Ghost (@UnplugFox) March 8, 2017 
https://t.co/cfeQkOAAG2 
If it's in response to the travel ban; brilliant. Since she stands to welcome immigrants üôåüèº
‚Äî trash queen (@harlotstarlet1) March 8, 2017 
The Statue Was Hacked By Russia 
According to parts of the Internet we‚Äôve all been hacked by ‚ÄòRussia‚Äô, so social media users were quick to joke about the lights being infiltrated. At least, we think it was a joke.
The Statue of Liberty was hacked by Russia!
‚Äî Brotato Chip (@LebroJenkins) March 8, 2017 
@congratulations @potus , the Statue of Liberty has gone dark. That's what Russia paid you to do isn't it? @PressSec Defend your weasel https://t.co/tyvjirAM7S 
‚Äî Dame J. E. Marshall (@DameJEMarshall) March 8, 2017 
Statue of liberty went dark, russia did it!!
‚Äî Duxcomedy (@duxcomedy) March 8, 2017 
#LightsOut at "Statue of Liberty" I guess Russia Hacked the lighting System . lol !
‚Äî asad karim (@asadkarim1) March 8, 2017 
Despite all the speculation, it looks like it really was just a power cut. After a period darkness, the lights on Lady Liberty are back on and normal service resumed.
